Hi Sarah - I'm not sure what kind of info you need or what assistance I can=


provide, but I have a lot of stuff up on Kido Koin/Katsura Kogoro up at
h=
ttp://red-bird.org/meiji2 . (I have recently updated the archive to
include=
 some information I picked up from another text I acquired a few
years bcak=
.)


If you have a particular need to understand Choshu - I can also recomm=
end
you pick up Thomas Hubers, " The Revolutionary Origins of Modern Japan"=

which really is just about Choshu - specifically covering Shoin, Kido,
Tak=
asugi, Genzui, and other political factions within Choshu.


Hope this help=
s...






On Tue, Sep 24, 2013 at 6:55 PM, Sarah LoBue <pilgrimscribe@yaho=
o.com>wrote:


> **
>
>
> Hello All,
> I am not exactly a new member, but i=
t's been about 8 years since I was a
> part of your community. I return in =
need of as much historical assistance
> y'all can provide.
> I am a writer =
and back then I had written a story that took place in 1866,
> the end of t=
he Meiji restoration. But now I find myself returning to this
> story and r=
e-writing it with a beginning in 1863-64. It is on its way to
> being my cr=
eative writing thesis and as such I want to capture more of this
> amazing =
and very interesting time.
> I want more of a focus on those who were invol=
ved, mostly from Satsuma and
> Choshu. Kido Koin and Kawakami Gensai being =
two of the supporting
> characters.
>
> I look forward to reading your post=
 and posting my own entries and such
>
> See ya around
> Sarah
>

<p></p><div style=3D"font-size:12pt;font-family:times new roman,new york,ti=
mes,serif"><div>Hello All,</div><div>I am not exactly a new member, but it&=
#39;s been about 8 years since I was a part of your community. I return in =
need of as much historical assistance y'all can provide.</div>
<div>I a=
m a writer and back then I had written a story that took place in 1866, the=
 end of the Meiji restoration. But now I find myself returning to this stor=
y and re-writing it with a beginning in 1863-64. It is on its way to being =
my creative writing thesis and as such I want to capture more of this amazi=
ng and very interesting time.=A0</div>
<div>I want more of a focus on those=
 who were involved, mostly from Satsuma and Choshu. Kido Koin and Kawakami =
Gensai being two of the supporting characters.</div><div><br></div><div sty=
le=3D"font-style:normal;font-size:16px;background-color:transparent;font-fa=
mily:'times new roman','new york',times,serif">
